VEC.Q: How many slices are there in this pie chart?
VEC.A: There are {6} slices in this pie chart.

SRP.Q: In the pie chart, what is the next slice in the clockwise direction from slice Heart Disease?
SRP.A: The next slice clockwise from slice Heart Disease is {Chronic Respiratory Diseases}.

SRP.Q: In the pie chart, what is the next slice in the counterclockwise direction from slice Heart Disease?
SRP.A: The next slice counterclockwise from slice Heart Disease is {Cancer}.

VPR.Q: Which disease has the largest proportion in this pie chart?
VPR.A: The disease with the largest proportion is {Influenza}.

VPR.Q: Which disease has the smallest proportion in this pie chart?
VPR.A: The disease with the smallest proportion is {Chronic Respiratory Diseases}.

VE.A: The value of the Alzheimer's Disease slice is {17}%.

VE.Q: What is the value of the Heart Disease slice in this pie chart?
VE.A: The value of the Heart Disease slice is {12}%.

SC.Q: What is the difference between the values of Diabetes and Cancer in this pie chart?
SC.A: The difference between Diabetes and Cancer is {10}%.

SC.Q: What is the sum of the values of Heart Disease and Alzheimer's Disease in this pie chart?
SC.A: The sum of Heart Disease and Alzheimer's Disease is {29}%.

NF.Q: Which categories in the pie chart exceed 21.5%? Please list the category names and corresponding percentages.

NC.Q: Which is larger, the value of Influenza or Diabetes?
Which is larger, the value of Influenza, Diabetes, or Alzheimer's Disease?

NC.A: The value of {Influenza} is the largest.

MSR.Q: How many sectors have a percentage between 5% and 15%?
MSR.A: There are {3} sectors that have a percentage between 5% and 15%.

MSR.Q: Which three sectors have a sum of percentage less than 40%? List all possible combinations.
MSR.A: The possible combinations are: {(Cancer, Heart Disease, Chronic Respiratory Diseases)}.
